subject: Languages
title: The Viking Gift to English
description: A quick win: understand The Viking Gift to English.

hook.text: Vikings invaded England to plunder. They stayed, and their language rewired English forever.

buildup.text: From the 800s, Norse settlers mixed with Anglo-Saxons across northern and eastern England.

discovery.text: Everyday words like 'sky,' 'egg,' 'take,' and 'they' came directly from Old Norse.

twist.text: Vikings didn't just add words â€” 'they,' 'them,' and 'their' replaced English pronouns.

climax.text: No other language in history has had its core pronouns replaced by a foreign tongue.

punchline.text: Every time you say 'they,' you're speaking Viking.

quiz.question: Which common English word came from Old Norse?
